meanings.definition: Covering or affecting a large area
meanings.sent1: The forest had an extensive canopy that provided shade for many animals.
meanings.sent2: The farmer owned an extensive piece of land that stretched for miles.
meanings.sent3: The cat's extensive nap left it feeling refreshed and ready to play.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of plants was as extensive as a library filled with books.
meanings.sent5: The detective conducted an extensive search for the missing keys, turning the house upside down.

meanings.sent1: The company made an extensive profit from their latest business venture.
meanings.sent2: She had an extensive collection of stamps from around the world.
meanings.sent3: The chef's extensive use of spices made the dish taste unique and flavorful.
meanings.sent4: His love for adventure was as extensive as the ocean, always seeking new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runner had to undergo extensive training to prepare for the race.

meanings.sent1: The student conducted an extensive research project on marine life.
meanings.sent2: The doctor performed an extensive examination to determine the cause of the illness.
meanings.sent3: The magician's extensive tricks amazed the audience with their complexity.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe was as extensive as a fashion designer's, filled with various styles.
meanings.sent5: The architect created an extensive blueprint detailing every aspect of the building.
